shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction (fols. 3ra–11rb [l.15]) - Mäqdәmä wängel “Introduction to the Gospel” (fols. 3ra–5vc) - Statement about the Eusebian sections (fols. 6ra–6rb [l.14]) - Letter of Eusebius to Carpian (fols. 6rb [l.15]–6rc) - Canon Tables (fols. 6v–10va) - The “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 10vb–10vc) - On the reliability of the Gospels (fols. 11ra–11rb [l.15]) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 11rb [l.16]–47vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fols. 11rb [l.16]–11rc) - Bәsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 12ra–47va) - Postscript (fol. 47vb) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 48ra–73va) - Biography of Mark (fols. 48ra–48rb [l.12]) - Statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 48rb, ls. 12-18) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fols. 48rb [l.19]–48vb) - Bәsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 51ra–73rb [l.16]) - Postscript (fols. 73rb [l.18]–73va) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 73vb–115ra [l.9]) - Biography of Luke (fols. 73vb–74ra [l.13]) - Statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 74ra, ls.13-19) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 83 titles (fols. 74ra [l.20]–75ra) - Bәsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 76ra–115ra [l.1]) - Postscript (fol. 115ra, ls. 2-9) V) Gospel of John (fols. 115ra [l.11]-146ra) - Biography of John (fols. 115ra [l.11]–115rb [l.21]) - Statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 115rb, ls. 21-25) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 20 titles (fol. 115va) - Bәsratä Yoḥannәs “Gospel of John” (fols. 116ra–146ra [l.7]) - Postscript (fol. 146ra, ls. 8-17)
Additiones 1-7.

donors.donor: According to Additio 7, the donor is blatta Gäbrä Ḥәywät.

bindings.binding: Wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Overback. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 2/fols. 1r-2v [missing fol. before 1]) ̶ I(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 3r-11v) ̶ II(8/fols. 12r-19v) ̶ III(8/fols. 20r-27v) ̶ IV(8/fols. 28r-35v) ̶ V(8/fols. 36r-43v) ̶ VI(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 44r-48v) ̶ VII(2/fols. 49r-50v) ̶ VIII(8/fols. 51r-58v) ̶ IX(8/fols. 59r-66v) ̶ X(9; s.l.: 2, stub after 8/fols. 67r-75v) ̶ XI(8/fols. 76r-83v) ̶ XII(8/fols. 84r-91v) ̶ XIII(8/fols. 92r-99v) ̶ XIV(8/fols. 100r-107v) ̶ XV (8/fols. 108r-115v) ̶ XVI(8/fols. 116r-123v) ̶ XVII(8/fols. 124r-131v) ̶ XVIII(8/fols. 132r-139v) ̶ XIX(8/fols. 140r-147v). Quire A is composed of two single leaves originating from a different, older manuscript.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the canon tables.

taunit.mr-info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel, recto side (fol. 13r).
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

margin.info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel, recto side (fol. 13r).

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. (for the fols. 3r-6r: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C). Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the canon tables.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the word mәʿәraf and the numbers of the chapters; some lines (in all the columns) of the incipit page of each text, divided into several groups, alternating with black lines: 5 lines on fol. 3r, 8 lines on fol. 12r, 7 lines on fol. 51r, 7 lines on fol. 76r, 7 lines on fol. 116r; one/two lines in the paragraph beginnings of each text and of some minor texts of the “Introduction”; the first two lines of the “postscript” of Matthew (s. fol. 47vb, ls. 1-2), of Mark (s. fol. 73rb, ls. 12-13), of Luke (s. fol. 115ra, ls. 2-3) and of John (fol. 146ra, ls. 8-9); the first two lines in the “Biography of Mark” (s. fol. 48ra, ls. 1-2), the “Biography of Luke” (fol. 73vb, ls. 1-2) and the “Biography of John” (fol. 115ra, ls. 11-12); the first two lines of the “Statement about the Eusebian sections” in the Gospel of Matthew (s. fol. 48rb, ls. 12-13), the Gospel of Mark (s. fol. 74ra, ls. 13-14) and the Gospel of John (s. 115rb, ls. 21-22); parts of the Canon tables; some extra notes, indicating the chapter titles; Ethiopic numerals indicating the “tituli”; elements of the punctuation signs.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Fols. 1r-2rv contain an excerpt from the "Mälkәʾa Ṗeṭros wä-Ṗawlos" (?), by a 17th- cent. hand. - Coloured and white threads are inserted in the edges of some folios. - Concerning the introduction, the contents and the postscript of the Gospels, cp. R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, Part I: General Introduction, Part II: Edition of the Gospel of Mark, Stuttgart 1989 (AeF 27), 1-31. - The postscripts for the Gospels of Matthew and John include a note on the date of origin of the Gospel.

additional.cont: Fols. 1r-2rv: Mälkәˀa Ṗeṭros wä-Ṗawlos "Image of Peter and Paul" (incomplete), followed by a short ˀarke-hymn.
additional.det: In a 18th-cent. hand, written on the fly-leaves (quire A). Incomplete, cp. the edition of the text: TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚƎLLASE (ed.), Mälkǝʾa Ṗeṭros wä-Ṗawlos, Addis Ababa 1992 E.C.; cp. also Ms. ATH-002.

additional.cont: Fol. 2vc, ls. 1-12: List of names.
Fol. 2vc, ls. 13-26: List of names.
Fol. 48va: Regulations of the church of Dәbla Däbrä Bәrhan Yoḥannәs Mätmәq.
additional.det: Extensive note, in Gәʿәz and Amharic.

additional.cont: Fol. 146r: Regulation concerning the use of land, established by the people and clergy of Dәbla Däbrä Bәrhan Yoḥannәs Mätmәq in 1939 E.C. (= 1947 A.D.).
additional.det: Written in the same hand as Additio 4?

additional.cont: Fol.  147r: Donation note.
additional.tran: Fol.  147r: This (is) the Gospel which blatta Gäbrä Ḥәywät donated to (the church of) Yoḥannәs Däbla. May the one who erased and stole this book be excommunicated through the mouth of Peter and Paul. May you not forget (to recite) Pater Noster for my sake! For eternity. Amen.

miniature.info: Fol. 11v: The Virgin and Child, the donor Gäbrä Ḥәywät.
miniature.details: Legend 1 (in the bottom margin): ከግብጽ፡ ሀገር፡ [n.l.]. Legend 2 (in the left margin): ዘከመ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡, “How Gäbrä Ḥәywät received in trust”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 47vb: Jesus Christ and the Samaritan Woman (Jn. 4: 1-29).
miniature.details: Legend (in the left margin): ዘከመ፡ ይቤላ፡ ለሣምራዊት፡ እስትይኒ፡ ማየ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡, “How our Lord Jesus said to the Samaritan woman: ´Give me some water`”.

miniature.info: Fol. 49r: St. John the Evangelist and his symbol (the eagle).
miniature.details: Legend (inside the miniature): ዘንሥር፡ ዮሐንስ፡, “John who is eagle”.

miniature.info: Fol. 49v: St. Mark the Evangelist and his symbol (the lion).
miniature.details: Legend (inside the miniature): ዘአንበሳ፡ ማርቆስ፡, “Mark who is lion”.

miniature.info: Fol. 50r: St. Matthew the Evangelist and his symbol (the man).
miniature.details: Legend (inside the miniature): ዘብእሲ፡ ማቴዎስ፡, “Matthew who is man”.

miniature.info: Fol. 50v: St. Luke the Evangelist and his symbol (the calf).
miniature.details: Legend (inside the miniature): ዘላህም፡ ሉቃስ፡, “Luke who is the veal”.

miniature.info: Fol. 73va: Jesus praying on the Mount of Olives and the angel with a chalice in the sky (Lk. 22: 39-46?).
miniature.details: Legend (in the upper margin): ዘከመ፡ ወሀቦ፡ ጽዋዕ[sic]፡ እምሰማይ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡, “How he gave the chalice to our Lord from the sky”.

miniature.info: Fol. 75r: Jesus and the miracle of the Paralytic (Mt. 9:1-8; Mk. 2: 2-12; Lk. 5: 17-26).
miniature.details: Legend (inside the miniature): ዘከመ፡ ይቤሎ፡ ለመፃጕዕ፡ ተንሥእ፡ ወፁር፡ አራትከ[sic]፡, “How (Jesus) said to the paralytic: ´raise up and go (and take) your bed´”.
Legend in the upper margin of the miniature): ዘከመ፡ አብሠራ፡ ገብርኤል፡, “How Gabrәʾel announced to her”.

miniature.info: Fol. 115vb: (at the top) The Assumption; (at the bottom): the donor wäyzäro Śännayt.
miniature.details: Legend 1 (top left margin): ዘከመ፡ ተወፈየት፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡, “How she was assumed into Heaven”. Legend 2 (top left margin): ዘከመ፡ ተማኅፃነት፡ ወዘሮ[sic]፡ ሠናይት፡, “How wäyzäro Śännayt received in trust”.

miniature.info: Fol. 146v: (at the top) Nicodemus and Jesus (Jn. 3: 1-21); (at the bottom) The miracle of five loaves and two fish (Mt. 14: 13-21; Mr. 6: 33-44; Lk. 9: 12-17).
miniature.details: Legend 1 (in the upper margin of the miniature): አማን፡ ዘከመ፡ ይቤሎ፡ ለእግዚእነ[sic]፡ ለኒቆዲሞስ፡ አማን፡ አማን፡ እብለከ፡, “´Verily`. How our Lord said to Nicodemus ´Verily, verily, I say to you”. Legend 2 (below the miniature): በ፪ዓሣ፡ ወበ፭ኅብስት፡ አጽገቦሙ፡ ለ፶፻፡, “With two fishes and with 5 loaves He satiated 5000”.

miniature.info: Fol. 147ra: Unfinished miniature of an Evangelist (?).
Fol. 147v: The Second Coming of Christ.
